instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Sensor issues and iStat Menus
threads.message: Got a MacBook Air 2015 with fast fan spin. I installed iStat, never used it before. If are sensors listed but only showing a hyphen, are they fucked sensors?

threads.title: Sensor issues and iStat Menus
threads.message: hold D on startup and run the diagnostic........  commonly water damage on trackpad, and/or flex...

threads.title: Sensor issues and iStat Menus
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 25979"]hold D on startup and run the diagnostic........ commonly water damage on trackpad, and/or flex...[/QUOTE]

Yep. First thing I tried was trackpad.
Diagnostic says SMC..... I'll sort the issue but my question is really about iStat. I was kind of just wondering how iStat menus works as I have seen people on the forum mention using it to find sensor issues.

threads.title: Sensor issues and iStat Menus
threads.message: No idea, which sensors are affected?

threads.title: Sensor issues and iStat Menus
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 26018"]No idea, which sensors are affected? [/QUOTE]

AirFlow Sensor
CPU, Platfor Controller Hub, S2 Cam proximity sensors.

And charger but I guess that could be because no charger is plugged.

threads.title: Sensor issues and iStat Menus
threads.message: SMBUS_SMC_1_S0_SDA bus problem. Unplug camera first.

threads.title: Sensor issues and iStat Menus
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 26088"]SMBUS_SMC_1_S0_SDA bus problem. Unplug camera first.
[/QUOTE]

Tried that. No change

threads.title: Sensor issues and iStat Menus
threads.message: Diode mode the 2 data lines and inspect for corrosion everywhere where these data lines go.
